summary: The Caribbean Anti-Smuggling of Trafficked Arms Act (CAST Act) mandates a report evaluating expanding the Joint Interagency Taskforce South's mission to combat illegal firearm trafficking from the U.S. to the Caribbean. The report, due 180 days after enactment, must assess feasibility, treaty adjustments, costs, force depletion, and coordination needs. The bill specifies the relevant congressional committees that will receive the report. The intent is to bolster efforts against arms smuggling in the Caribbean region.
